text: Draught at Stone's Liberty Station. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, ripe fruits, oak, bourbon, toffee, dried fruits and a bit of grass. Bitter finish with citrus, oak, bourbon, ripe fruits, toffee, dried fruits and earthy notes. Excellent brew.

Lots of oak flavor. Very sweet malty. Thick on tongue. Light ark caramel and lots of very enjoyable. Malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Amber beer with a cream head. Red wine and light bourbon aroma. Bourbon and light yeast flavor. Medium bodied. Bourbon and light yeast lingers with light spice and light red wine.

Deep Amber. Liked this better than the port version we had a while back. Subtle and expertly balanced red wine berries, oak, & bourbon are showcased on a lightly yeasty backdrop. Cool beer. Doesnt show the abv either.
Bottle from Sierra Nevada Mills River - pours amber with a white head. Has some great caramel notes with a piney finish. Nice!

Bottle from Sierra Nevada Mills River. Pours golden with a thick white head. Leaves a lot of lacing in the glass. Lots of whiskey and wood on the nose. Very smooth on the tongue with a fair but not oppressive amount of whiskey. Hides its booze well. Nice!

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 10/19/2016. Pours slightly hazy deep orange/copper color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky off white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big golden raisin, plum, fig, date, apricot, apple, red grape, straw, grass, caramel, brown sugar, brown bread, and biscuit; with lighter notes of pepper, vanilla, toffee, bourbon, coconut, toasted oak, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/earthy yeast, dark/bready malt, and wine/bourbon barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big golden raisin, plum, fig, date, apricot, apple, red grape, straw, grass, caramel, brown sugar, brown bread, and biscuit; with lighter notes of pepper, vanilla, toffee, bourbon, coconut, toasted oak, and yeast earthiness. Light yeast/tannic oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of light/dark fruits, straw, grass, caramel, brown sugar, brown bread, biscuit, toffee, bourbon, coconut, toasted oak, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, dark/bready malt, and wine/bourbon barrel flavors; with a nice malt/barrel/spiciness balance, and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Minimal dryness. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky, and slightly slick/sticky/tannic mouthfeel that is nice. Minimal warming alcohol for 9.8%; with zero barrel booziness. Overall this is an excellent barrel aged Biere de Garde style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/earthy yeast, dark/bready malt, and wine/bourbon barrel flavors; very smooth and easy to sip on for the big ABV. Awesome balance of malt/yeast flavors; with near perfect integration of the barrel complexity. Spot on for the style. A very enjoyable offering.

Tap. Pours hazy copper, large creamy beige head, nice lacing. Aroma is quite herbal, some vinous notes, grain, clove. Flavors is light plus sweet, light bitter herbal and vinous, field grass. Not a lot of bourbon influence. Medium body, smooth and silky mouthfeel. Well crafted but not hitting my sweet spot. Gets better as it warms.
On tap at Sierra Nevada Torpedo. Pours dark amber with a nice beige head and an earthy aroma. There is a hearty musty dark malt flavor with lots of bourbon and a hint of wine.

Draught at Sierra Nevada Torpedo Room, Berkeley. Clear golden/copper beer with a small beige head. Fruity coconut aroma, raisins, figs, vanilla woods, grape notes, vinous, some caramel. Fruity coconut flavor, raisins, caramel, vinous, raisins, warming alcohol, some wood. Biere de Garde on steroids, more like a barley wine. Pretty damn nice.
